data.title: Southampton vs Lazio Predicted lineup, betting tips, odds, injury news, H2H, telecast | Pre-season friendlies 2024
data.meta_description: Newly promoted Premier League side Southampton face Serie A side Lazio in a pre-season friendly ahead of the start of the 2024-25 new season.
data.text:
The Saints set to lock horns against high-flying Lazio.

Having narrowly edged past Leeds United in the Championship promotion final, Southampton have re-entered the Premier League. They kicked off their pre-season campaign in spectacular fashion, annihilating Eastleigh 7-1 in their opener. This was followed by two more consecutive victories against Bordeaux and Montpellier. However, Des Buckingham’s Oxford United handed them their first defeat of the campaign. Southampton bounced back in their most recent fixture, securing a narrow victory over Millwall.

Lazio, on the other hand, will be disappointed to have missed out on a UEFA Champions League spot, falling just short by a few points to fifth-placed Bologna. Despite the additional berth for Italian teams in the UCL, Lazio had to settle for a spot in the UEFA Europa League. Their pre-season campaign has been impressive so far, remaining unbeaten. They secured victories over Trapani 1905, Hansa, and Frosinone before drawing against Triestina.

Both squads have exhibited a remarkable pre-season campaign thus far. Lazio will be intent on perpetuating their undefeated streak, whereas Southampton will be eager to elevate their morale with a victory over the Eagles.

Kick-Off:

Thursday, 8 August 2024 at 12:00 AM IST

Location: St. Mary’s Stadium, Southampton, England

Form:

Southampton (in all competitions): W-L-W-W-W

Lazio (in all competitions): W-W-D-W-D

Players to watch:

Yukinari Sugawara (Southampton)

The Japanese international from Toyokawa has had a stellar pre-season campaign, establishing himself as a pivotal player for Southampton. Standing at 5 feet 10 inches, Sugawara also boasts the record for the most appearances for AZ Alkmaar, affectionately known as The Cheese Farmers, in UEFA club competitions. He was a key member of the Japanese under-19 squad that clinched third place in the AFC U-19 Championship in 2018.

Sugawara has already made significant contributions for Southampton, registering a goal and an assist in their pre-season fixtures. His dynamic play on the right flank will be indispensable for manager Russell Martin as he aims to propel the Saints to new heights in the upcoming season.

Tijjani Noslin (SS Lazio)

The 6-foot-tall Dutch centre forward from Amsterdam, Tijjani Noslin, is poised to make a significant impact when Lazio visits St. Mary’s Stadium to face Southampton. The 25-year-old forward has had stints with USV Hercules, Fortuna Sittard, and Hellas Verona.

Despite a setback with a failed trial at an academy in Manchester, Noslin found success with USV Hercules, where he made 26 appearances and scored 10 goals. The promising prodigy has caught the eye of Rafael van der Vaart, who praised him as “a nice player who is always dangerous. He is very direct and possesses all the qualities.” Noslin’s presence will be crucial for Lazio as they look to secure a victory against the Saints.

Match facts:

Lazio are unbeaten in their last five fixtures.

Southampton are coming after a narrow victory over Millwall.

Lazio kept two clean sheets in their pre-season campaign so far.

Southampton vs Lazio: Betting Tips and Odds

Tip 1: Match to end in a draw.

Tip 2: Both teams to score.

Tip 3: At least one goal to be scored in the second half.

Injury and team news:

Apart from the exception of Gavin Bazanu, Russell Martin will have the luxury to pick his best combination of players from a fully fit and available squad.

SS Lazio will most likely miss the presence of Spanish centre-back Mario Gila, Portuguese left-back Nuno Tavares, and Paraguayan winger Diego Gonzalez.

Head to head:

There doesn’t seem to be any record of these two sides previously meeting each other. This could possibly be the first of many encounters between these two teams.

Predicted lineup:

Southampton predicted lineup (4-2-3-1):

McCarthy (GK); Sugawara, Stephens, Bednarek, Taylor; Harwood-Bellis, Downes; Aribo, Smallbone, Edozie; Armstrong

SS Lazio predicted lineup (4-3-1-2):

Provedel (GK); Lazzari, Casale, Patric, Pellegrini; Dele-Bashiru, Cataldi, Zaccagni; Guendouzi; Noslin, Tchaouna

Match prediction for Southampton vs Lazio:

Both teams are equally fierce and competent to edge past each other. Looking at the recent form of both these teams, a draw would be a satisfactory outcome as both sides would nullify each other’s threats.

Prediction: Southampton 2-2 Lazio
